Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery belly amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of horse (three locks of mane in added red and part of neck remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see the amphora in Toulouse (26.169), possibly from Etruria (Birchall 1972, pl. 17a).
Bibliographic references: Birchall 1972 / Attic Horse-Head Amphorae (p. 48, p. 58, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0001) (Phase 1)
